33.1.why: Withdraws to privately process and contain the story, sometimes guarding information out of fear of exposure; that's controlled retreat and privacy, not confronting exploitation or restoring someone’s sovereignty — not Andromeda.

33.2.why: Steps away to reset and decompress without drama, or goes cold and refuses contact if pushed; that's emotional recovery through withdrawal, not anti-domination rescue — not Andromeda.

33.3.why: Learns discretion by oversharing, getting burned, and then tightening access; that's self-protection around narrative control, not liberating the oppressed or challenging abusive power — not Andromeda.

33.4.why: Closes chapters for the group and curates how the story gets remembered, including controlling the record; that's ritualized memory-keeping and historical spin, not stepping into abuse dynamics to restore dignity — not Andromeda.

33.5.why: Gets asked to speak for everyone's sensitive history and then gets blamed as biased or manipulative; that's archivist/spokesperson politics, not sovereignty defense for the exploited — not Andromeda.

33.6.why: Models dignified retreat ('I step back to protect the soul and the bond') and can become totally inaccessible; that's sacred privacy, not anti-domination intervention — not Andromeda.

34.1.why: Wants to understand and aim personal power responsibly and fears misusing force; that's self-regulation of raw strength, not liberation of someone under domination — not Andromeda (closer to survival-force ethics).

34.2.why: Radiates 'I can move this by myself' and resists being managed, then withdraws cooperation when controlled; that's lone-force dominance posture, not stepping in to free exploited others — not Andromeda.

34.3.why: Learns limits of force by pushing too hard in live conflict and then owning the mess, and can gain a rep as dangerous muscle; that's power calibration and reputation volatility, not anti-domination rescue — not Andromeda.

34.4.why: Uses raw energy to defend allies and stabilize the unit, and in shadow enforces loyalty through intimidation; that's tribal muscle and 'stay loyal because I protect you,' which is pressure-based protection, not liberation-of-the-oppressed — not Andromeda.

34.5.why: Gets called in to 'handle it right now' with decisive force and is later blamed as a bully or tyrant; that's emergency enforcer energy, not sovereignty defense for the abused — not Andromeda.

34.6.why: Lives as unapologetic power aligned with purpose and can slip into 'I don't need any of you'; that's lone-force self-authority, not stepping in to dismantle exploitation for others — not Andromeda.

35.1.why: Needs novelty and asks 'is there more than this routine,' then feels emotionally starved if nothing changes; that's hunger for experience, not freeing anyone from control — not Andromeda.

35.2.why: Attracts intense experiences and narrates them so others feel it, then withdraws if pressured to perform; that's charismatic adventure/storytelling, not sovereignty restoration — not Andromeda.

35.3.why: Throws self into intense situations, crashes, and learns by regrouping; that's impulsive trial-by-experience rather than confronting abusive power structures — not Andromeda.

35.4.why: Pulls the group into shared rites of passage and can stir drama just to keep everyone emotionally hooked; that's bonding-through-intensity, not intervening against exploitation — not Andromeda.

35.5.why: Gets cast as 'save us from stagnation' and is blamed as chaotic if comfort is lost; that's boredom-fixer projection, not 'free us from oppression' projection — not Andromeda.

35.6.why: Embodies 'I've tasted life; here's what it really costs,' then drifts into jaded detachment; that's elder-of-experience witness, not liberation / anti-domination action — not Andromeda.

36.1.why: Feels incoming chaos, braces for humiliation, and can freeze assuming the worst; that's crisis anxiety and paralysis, not active defense of someone's dignity — not Andromeda.

36.2.why: Moves inside emotional turbulence without totally losing center and later goes cold about being used for drama; that's intuitive crisis navigation, not direct liberation from domination — not Andromeda.

36.3.why: Builds maturity by surviving high-stress breakdowns and can escalate crisis just to feel alive; that's crisis-as-initiation, not sovereignty defense — not Andromeda.

36.4.why: Stabilizes people through peak panic and in shadow uses that caretaking to secure loyalty ('you need me'); that's emotional containment and attachment leverage, not anti-oppression intervention — not Andromeda.

36.5.why: Gets summoned as the crisis fixer when everything melts down and is expected to take charge for everyone, then is blamed as manipulative if relief isn't instant — that's the Andromeda shadow savior/martyr pattern where you're forced to absorb the danger for the group and punished for having boundaries.

36.6.why: Embodies 'I've lived through storms; you're going to survive this too' and can drift into 'toughen up' superiority; that's veteran-of-turbulence teaching, not liberation from coercive control — not Andromeda.

37.1.why: Wants clear agreements about duty and loyalty inside the bond and may cling to tradition even if it's unfair; that's domestic contract enforcement, not breaking abusive power on behalf of the oppressed — not Andromeda.

37.2.why: Makes people feel welcomed into 'family' and then withholds warmth if unappreciated; that's belonging and caretaking politics, not sovereignty defense — not Andromeda.

37.3.why: Learns fair partnership by butting heads and can weaponize guilt and obligation; that's negotiating domestic terms with emotional leverage, not anti-domination intervention — not Andromeda.

37.4.why: Holds the group together around shared kindness and duty and can play 'good cop' to maintain influence; that's peacekeeping / internal diplomacy, not standing up to exploitation — not Andromeda.

37.5.why: Gets treated like the emotional provider who must hold the household together and is called manipulative or smothering if they ask for reciprocity; that's projected hearth-keeper duty, not liberation work — not Andromeda.

37.6.why: Embodies 'we protect each other, that's the law here' and can gatekeep who counts as family; that's tribal kinship defense and belonging control, not universal sovereignty restoration — not Andromeda.

38.1.why: Needs a cause worth struggling for and collapses into aimless hopelessness if the fight seems pointless; that's Andromeda shadow burnout — when liberation feels impossible the will to resist drops instead of acting — Andromeda shadow.

38.2.why: Stands ground against what feels wrong without needing applause and refuses to 'just go along,' which is direct refusal to submit to coercion and defense of personal sovereignty — Andromeda core.

38.3.why: Figures out what is worth defending by entering real confrontations and testing the line, risking backlash to locate the injustice that must be resisted; that's prototyping resistance in live conditions — Andromeda core.

38.4.why: Rallies others around 'we don't let this happen to our people,' actively organizing collective defense of the vulnerable against harm; that's textbook Andromeda core liberation / protection of the oppressed — Andromeda core.

38.5.why: Gets cast as the public champion who's expected to confront injustice and take the hit, then is labeled 'aggressive' or 'the problem' for doing it; that's the Andromeda shadow martyr/savior projection — Andromeda shadow.

38.6.why: Lives as 'I exist to stand against what's wrong' and can turn that stance into a suffering-as-identity posture where pain becomes the brand; that's Andromeda shadow — resistance internalized as personal crucifixion instead of shared liberation — Andromeda shadow.

39.1.why: Probes emotional blockages and fears rejection if others shut down; that's intimacy provocation, not anti-domination rescue — not Andromeda.

39.2.why: Pokes people's emotions in a way that can open closeness and then sulks if called 'too much'; that's catalytic intimacy play, not sovereignty defense — not Andromeda.

39.3.why: Pushes buttons bluntly to wake people up and risks being seen as manipulative drama-starter; that's pressure for emotional aliveness, not freeing someone from exploitation — not Andromeda.

39.4.why: Shakes the group out of numbness so connection can come back and can use that tension to control access ('who feels safe with whom'); that's emotional leverage, not liberation from domination — not Andromeda.

39.5.why: Gets expected to 'wake us up' when things go flat and is blamed as toxic when the awakening hurts; that's stagnation-breaker projection, not 'save us from oppression' projection — not Andromeda.

39.6.why: Embodies 'pressure is how we access real feeling and truth' and can posture as emotionally superior; that's intimacy-through-friction, not sovereignty liberation — not Andromeda.

40.1.why: Feels duty to deliver support and feed the bond and then becomes the exhausted martyr who can't admit burnout; that's obligation-based provision, not anti-domination rescue — not Andromeda.

40.2.why: Gives resources and presence to prove 'you're not alone' and then pulls away hard if taken for granted; that's tribal provider / loyalty contract, not direct liberation of the oppressed — not Andromeda.

40.3.why: Overgives, burns out, disappears, then renegotiates terms, creating hot/cold availability; that's boundary training around service, not confronting abusive control — not Andromeda.

40.4.why: Insists on fair exchange — 'I'll do my part if you do yours' — and can keep emotional score ('you owe me'); that's contract enforcement in the bond, not sovereignty defense — not Andromeda.

40.5.why: Gets cast as the emergency provider who's supposed to 'save the day' when everyone else bails, then is attacked as controlling if they ask for terms — that's the Andromeda shadow martyr/savior imprint where you're expected to rescue the group at personal cost — Andromeda shadow.

40.6.why: Shows deep loyalty but also demands alone time to recharge and can slip into 'I'm the only real adult here'; that's lone-wolf provider sovereignty, not stepping in to dismantle exploitation for others — not Andromeda.
